emergency.title: üö® IMMEDIATE SUPPORT AVAILABLE
emergency.message: I hear you. You're not alone. Please reach out to one of these numbers right now. They are trained to help. You matter. Help is available.

faq1.question: How effective are condoms?
faq1.answer: Condoms are about 98% effective when used correctly every time. They also protect against STIs including HIV. Use a new condom for every sexual act.

faq2.question: Can I get pregnant during my period?
faq2.answer: Yes, though less likely. Sperm can live in the body for up to 5 days, so if you have a short cycle, pregnancy is possible. Use protection consistently.

faq3.question: How do I know if I have an STI?
faq3.answer: Many STIs have no symptoms. Common signs include unusual discharge, sores, pain during urination, or itching. Get tested regularly if sexually active.

faq4.question: Is HIV curable?
faq4.answer: HIV is not curable, but it is treatable. Antiretroviral therapy (ARVs) allows people with HIV to live long, healthy lives. With treatment, viral load can become undetectable.

faq5.question: What is consent?
faq5.answer: Consent is clear, voluntary agreement to engage in sexual activity. It must be freely given, can be withdrawn anytime, and silence or "maybe" is not consent.

faq6.question: Where can I get free condoms?
faq6.answer: Free condoms are available at government health facilities, PPAG clinics, youth-friendly centers, and some NGO offices across Ghana.

faq7.question: How can I manage stress?
faq7.answer: Healthy stress management includes: regular exercise, adequate sleep, talking to someone you trust, deep breathing exercises, and engaging in hobbies you enjoy.

faq8.question: What should I do if I'm feeling suicidal?
faq8.answer: Call a crisis hotline immediately (Suicide Prevention: 0800234567). Talk to a trusted adult, counselor, or healthcare provider. You are not alone, and help is available.

faq9.question: Can I get the morning-after pill without prescription?
faq9.answer: Yes, emergency contraception (Postinor-2, Plan B) is available over-the-counter at pharmacies in Ghana. Most effective within 72 hours of unprotected sex.

faq10.question: How do I get tested for HIV?
faq10.answer: Free HIV testing is available at Voluntary Counseling and Testing (VCT) centers, government hospitals, and PPAG clinics. Testing is confidential.

welcome.title: Your Mental Wellness Matters
welcome.text: Taking care of your mental health is just as important as your physical health. Mental wellness affects every aspect of your life, including your sexual health, relationships, and overall well-being.
welcome.whyMatters: Why Mental Health Matters for Sexual Health

depression.title: Depression Screening
depression.info: Screens for symptoms of depression including mood, interest, sleep, and energy

anxiety.title: Anxiety Screening
anxiety.info: Screens for generalized anxiety disorder including worry, restlessness, and fear

assessment.confidentialNote: All responses are confidential and stored locally on your device

results.title: Your Results
results.disclaimer: This is a screening tool, not a professional diagnosis. For a complete evaluation, please consult a licensed mental health provider or your doctor.

stressManagement.title: Stress Management
stressManagement.text: Based on your questions, try deep breathing exercises daily and maintain a regular sleep schedule.

familyPlanning.title: Family Planning
familyPlanning.text: Consider visiting a family planning clinic for personalized contraception advice.

regularTesting.title: Regular Testing
regularTesting.text: Get tested for STIs every 6 months if sexually active. Free testing available at VCT centers.

stayHealthy.title: Stay Healthy
stayHealthy.text: Keep asking questions! Regular check-ups and safe practices are key to good sexual health.
